Key Match Events: Cleveland began the second quarter with a 24-6 run, fueled by its two big men, to build a commanding 53-29 lead.
Others: Darius Garland scored 25 points, Jarrett Allen had 19 points and 11 rebounds, and the NBA-leading Cleveland Cavaliers beat the Charlotte Hornets 115-105 on Sunday night to extend their winning streak to 10.
LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller paced Charlotte with 24 points apiece.
Donovan Mitchell had 17 of his 19 points in the second half and Evan Mobley added 17 for Cleveland.
